Show / Hide Table of Contents

Interface IWebView

IWebView is the primary interface for loading and interacting with web content. It contains methods and properties for common browser-related functionality, like LoadUrl(), GoBack(), Reload(), and ExecuteJavaScript().

Namespace: Vuplex.WebView
Assembly: Assembly-CSharp.dll
Syntax
public interface IWebView
Remarks

To create an IWebView, instantiate a WebViewPrefab or CanvasWebViewPrefab. After the prefab is initialized, you can access its IWebView via the WebViewPrefab.WebView property. If your use case requires a high degree of customization, you can instead create an IWebView outside of a prefab (to connect to your own custom GameObject) by using Web.CreateWebView().

For additional functionality, you can cast an IWebView to an interface for a specific feature, like IWithDownloads or IWithPopups. For a list of additional feature interfaces and information about how to use them, see this page: https://developer.vuplex.com/webview/additional-interfaces

See also:

Property Value
Type Description

PageLoadScripts

Gets a list of JavaScript scripts that are automatically executed in every new page that is loaded.

Declaration
List<string> PageLoadScripts { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.List<System.String>
Remarks

This list is empty by default, but the application can add scripts. When used in conjunction with 3D WebView's message passing API, it's possible to modify the browser's behavior in significant ways, similar to creating browser extensions.

Examples
// Add a script that automatically hides all scrollbars.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.PageLoadScripts.Add(@"
    var styleElement = document.createElement('style');
    styleElement.innerText = 'body::-webkit-scrollbar { display: none; }';
    document.head.appendChild(styleElement);
");
See Also
ExecuteJavaScript(String)
JS-to-C# message passing

Texture

Gets the texture for the webview's web content.

Declaration
Texture2D Texture { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
UnityEngine.Texture2D
Remarks

This texture is an "external texture" created with Texture2D.CreateExternalTexture(). An undocumented characteristic of external textures in Unity is that not all Texture2D methods work for them. For example, Texture2D.GetRawTextureData() and ImageConversion.EncodeToPNG() fail for external textures. To compensate, the IWebView interface includes its own GetRawTextureData() and CaptureScreenshot() methods to replace them.

Another quirk of this texture is that Unity always reports its size as 1300px × 1300px in the editor. In reality, 3D WebView resizes the texture in native code to match the dimensions of the webview, but Unity doesn't provide an API to notify the engine that an external texture's size has changed. So, Unity always reports its size as the initial size that was passed to Texture2D.CreateExternalTexture(), which in 3D WebView's case is 1300px × 1300px.

This property is unused when running in Native 2D Mode.

Examples
// Apply the webview's texture to another material.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
// On Android, the material must be created with Web.CreateMaterial().
// On other platforms, you could potentially use other materials.
var anotherMaterial = await Web.CreateMaterial();
anotherMaterial.mainTexture = webViewPrefab.WebView.Texture;

Title

Gets the current web page title.

Declaration
string Title { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.String
Examples
// Get the page's title after it finishes loading.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadProgressChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    if (eventArgs.Type == ProgressChangeType.Finished) {
        Debug.Log("Page title: " + webViewPrefab.WebView.Title);
    }
};

Click(Vector2)

Clicks at the given point in the webpage, dispatching both a mouse down and a mouse up event.

Declaration
void Click(Vector2 point)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Vector2 point

The x and y components of the point are values in the range of [0, 1] that are normalized to the webview's width and height. For example, point.x = xInPixels / webView.SizeInPixels.x. Like in the browser, the origin is in the upper-left corner, the positive direction of the y-axis is down, and the positive direction of the x-axis is right.
Examples
// Click the point at (250px, 100px) in the web page.
var normalizedPoint = new Vector2(250, 100) / webViewPrefab.WebView.SizeInPixels;
webViewPrefab.WebView.Click(normalizedPoint);

Click(Vector2, Boolean)

Like Click(Vector2 point) but with an additional option to prevent stealing focus.

Declaration
void Click(Vector2 point, bool preventStealingFocus)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Vector2 point
System.Boolean preventStealingFocus

Dispose()

Destroys the webview, releasing all of its resources.

Declaration
void Dispose()
Remarks

If you're using a WebViewPrefab or CanvasWebViewPrefab, please call Destroy() on the prefab instead of calling IWebView.Dispose(). Calling IWebView.Dispose() while the prefab is still using the webview can cause issues.

ExecuteJavaScript(String, Action<String>)

Like the other version of ExecuteJavaScript(), except it uses a callback instead of a Task to return the result. If you don't need the result from executing the JavaScript, you can improve the method's efficiency by passing null as the callback argument.

HandleKeyboardInput(String)

Dispatches keyboard input to the webview.

Declaration
void HandleKeyboardInput(string key)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String key

A key can either be a single character representing a unicode character (e.g. "A", "b", "?") or a JavaScript key value (e.g. "ArrowUp", "Enter", "Backspace", "Delete").
Examples
// Type "Hi!" and then submit the Enter key.
webViewPrefab.WebView.HandleKeyboardInput("H");
webViewPrefab.WebView.HandleKeyboardInput("i");
webViewPrefab.WebView.HandleKeyboardInput("!");
webViewPrefab.WebView.HandleKeyboardInput("Enter");
See Also
IWithKeyDownAndUp

Important notes:

LoadHtml(String)

Loads the webpage contained in the given HTML string.

Declaration
void LoadHtml(string html)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String html
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadHtml(@"
    <!DOCTYPE html>
    <html>
        <head>
            <title>Test Page</title>
            <style>
                h1 {
                    font-family: Helvetica, Arial, Sans-Serif;
                }
            </style>
        </head>
        <body>
            <h1>LoadHtml Example</h1>
            <script>
                console.log('This page was loaded!');
            </script>
        </body>
    </html>"
);
See Also
LoadUrl(String)

LoadUrl(String)

Loads the given URL. Supported URL schemes:

  • http://, https:// - loads a remote page over HTTP
  • streaming-assets:// - loads a local page from StreamingAssets (equivalent to &quot;file://&quot; + Application.streamingAssetsPath + path)
  • file:// - some platforms support loading arbitrary file URLs
Declaration
void LoadUrl(string url)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String url
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadUrl("https://vuplex.com");
See Also
How to load local files
LoadHtml(String)

LoadUrl(String, Dictionary<String, String>)

Like LoadUrl(string url), but also sends the given additional HTTP request headers when loading the URL. The headers are sent for the initial page load request but are not sent for requests for subsequent resources, like linked JavaScript or CSS files.

Declaration
void LoadUrl(string url, Dictionary<string, string> additionalHttpHeaders)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String url
System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.String, System.String> additionalHttpHeaders
Remarks

On Windows and macOS, this method cannot be used to set the Accept-Language header. For more info, please see this article.

Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadUrl("https://vuplex.com", new Dictionary<string, string> {
    ["Authorization"] = "Basic YWxhZGRpbjpvcGVuc2VzYW1l",
    ["Cookie"] = "foo=bar"
});

void Paste()

PostMessage(String)

Posts a message that JavaScript within the webview can listen for using window.vuplex.addEventListener(&apos;message&apos;, function(message) {}).

Declaration
void PostMessage(string data)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String data

String that is passed as the data property of the message object.
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WebView.WaitUntilInitialized();
// Add some JavaScript to the page to receive the message.
webViewPrefab.WebView.PageLoadScripts(@"
    window.vuplex.addEventListener('message', function(event) {
        console.log('Message received from C#: ' + event.data);
    });
");
// When the page finishes loading, send a message from C# to JavaScript.
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadProgressChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    if (eventArgs.Type == ProgressChangeType.Finished) {
        webViewPrefab.WebView.PostMessage("Hello from C#");
    }
};

Scroll(Vector2)

Scrolls the top-level document by the given scroll delta. This method works by calling window.scrollBy(), which doesn't work for all web pages. An alternative is to instead use Scroll(scrollDelta, position) to scroll at a specific location in the page. For example, you can scroll at the middle of the page by calling Scroll(scrollDelta, new Vector2(0.5f, 0.5f)).

Declaration
void Scroll(Vector2 scrollDelta)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Vector2 scrollDelta

The scroll delta in Unity units. Because the browser's origin is in the upper-left corner, the y-axis' positive direction is down and the x-axis' positive direction is right.
Examples
// Scroll down
webViewPrefab.WebView.Scroll(new Vector2(0.25f, 0));

Scroll(Vector2, Vector2)

Declaration
void Scroll(Vector2 scrollDelta, Vector2 point)
Parameters
Type Name Description
UnityEngine.Vector2 scrollDelta
UnityEngine.Vector2 point

SetRenderingEnabled(Boolean)

Enables or disables the webview's ability to render to its texture. By default, a webview renders web content to its texture, but you can use this method to disable or re-enable rendering.

Declaration
void SetRenderingEnabled(bool enabled)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Boolean enabled
Remarks

This method is ignored when running in Native 2D Mode.

Examples

webViewPrefab.WebView.SetRenderingEnabled(false);

SetResolution(Single)

Sets the webview's resolution in pixels per Unity unit. You can change the resolution to make web content appear larger or smaller.

Declaration
void SetResolution(float pixelsPerUnityUnit)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Single pixelsPerUnityUnit
Remarks

Unlike the other IWebView methods, this method can be called before the webview is initialized with Init(). The default resolution is 1300 pixels per Unity unit. Setting a lower resolution decreases the pixel density, but has the effect of making web content appear larger. Setting a higher resolution increases the pixel density, but has the effect of making content appear smaller. For more information on scaling web content, see this support article.

This method is ignored when running in Native 2D Mode.

Examples
// Set the resolution to 1800px per Unity unit.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.SetResolution(1800);
See Also
Resolution
Resize(Single, Single)

ZoomIn()

Zooms into the currently loaded web content.

Declaration
void ZoomIn()
Remarks

Note that the zoom level gets reset when a new page is loaded.

Examples
// Zoom in after the page finishes loading.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadProgressChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    if (eventArgs.Type == ProgressChangeType.Finished) {
        webViewPrefab.WebView.ZoomIn();
    }
};

ZoomOut()

Zooms back out after a previous call to ZoomIn().

Declaration
void ZoomOut()
Remarks

Note that the zoom level gets reset when a new page is loaded.

Examples
// Zoom out after the page finishes loading.
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadProgressChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    if (eventArgs.Type == ProgressChangeType.Finished) {
        webViewPrefab.WebView.ZoomOut();
    }
};

Indicates that the page has requested to close (i.e. via window.close()).

Declaration
event EventHandler CloseRequested
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.CloseRequested += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log("Close requested");
};

ConsoleMessageLogged

Indicates that a message was logged to the JavaScript console.

Declaration
event EventHandler<ConsoleMessageEventArgs> ConsoleMessageLogged
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<ConsoleMessageEventArgs>
Remarks

The 3D WebView packages for Android with Gecko, iOS, and UWP have the following limitations:

Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.ConsoleMessageLogged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log($"Console message logged: [{eventArgs.Level}] {eventArgs.Message}");
};

FocusedInputFieldChanged

Indicates when an input field has been focused or unfocused. This can be used, for example, to determine when to show or hide an on-screen keyboard. Note that this event is currently only fired for input fields focused in the main frame and is not fired for input fields in iframes.

Declaration
event EventHandler<FocusedInputFieldChangedEventArgs> FocusedInputFieldChanged
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<FocusedInputFieldChangedEventArgs>
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.FocusedInputFieldChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log("Focused input field changed. Text input is focused: " + eventArgs.Type == FocusedInputFieldType.Text);
};

LoadProgressChanged

Indicates that the page load progress changed.

Declaration
event EventHandler<ProgressChangedEventArgs> LoadProgressChanged
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<ProgressChangedEventArgs>
Remarks

On Windows and macOS, this event isn't raised for intermediate load progress (ProgressChangeType.Updated) because Chromium doesn't provide an API for estimated load progress.

Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
webViewPrefab.WebView.LoadProgressChanged += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log($"Load progress changed: {eventArgs.Type}, {eventArgs.Progress}");
    if (eventArgs.Type == ProgressChangeType.Finished) {
        Debug.Log("The page finished loading");
    }
};

MessageEmitted

Indicates that JavaScript running in the page used the window.vuplex.postMessage JavaScript API to emit a message to the Unity application. For more details, please see this support article.

Declaration
event EventHandler<EventArgs<string>> MessageEmitted
Event Type
Type Description
System.EventHandler<EventArgs<System.String>>
Examples
await webViewPrefab.WaitUntilInitialized();
// Add JavaScript to the page that sends a message.
webViewPrefab.WebView.PageLoadScripts.Add(@"
    window.vuplex.postMessage('Hello from JavaScript!');
");
webViewPrefab.WebView.MessageEmitted += (sender, eventArgs) => {
    Debug.Log("Message received from JavaScript: " + eventArgs.Value);
};
See Also
ExecuteJavaScript(String)

VideoRectChanged

Indicates that the rect of the playing video changed. This event is only used for iOS's fallback video implementation, and WebViewPrefab and CanvasWebViewPrefab automatically handles this event for you.
